Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @wookie and @zpajk thanks for documenting that. it was one of our longer periods. Even with those longer blocks, we do average 1 minute blocks. We have had long blocks periodically, but that was unusual. In any case, it is still within the statistical norms and can happen. There is some newer research on methods to reduce the high variance, and we will be looking into potential improvement in that area after rounding out the PBaaS work.

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> We use Zcash Sapling (and an updated Sprout) for zero knowledge, so that vulnerability doesn't apply to VRSC.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> As @Oink mentioned, Verus has unique algorithms for a number of things, like proof of power (PoS/PoW), addressing nothing at stake, and further enhancing Komodo crypto conditions to enable PBaaS with merge mining, which has just started early testing. Right now, we're focusing on the next update of PBaaS testing, to make the autonotarization and payouts fully functional, and then reserve conversions.
